This is a fun toy, that keeps a child busy, and makes a great present for a B-day , Christmas, or
just cause you love the kids.

title: The kids love this toy, keeps them busy.
text:
VTech Go Magical Unicorn .

I got this for my grandchildren when they come here to play, and there here at least a couple of times a week.
The 3 yr old girl cannot let this Unicorn out of her hands. She does not want to share with her sister (one) or boy cousin (2).
For the younger then 2yr child,(although it says 18mo to 5) Just watching it move and make sounds is exciting, and they can interact.
Press the Heart on the chest, and this walks, talks, head moves,and wings fly. This has everything. Sounds , lights , talks , feed the Unicorn its carrot.
Over 40 songs, sounds and phrases it says on here..Although I have not notice there are that many!!

There are so many different toys out there, that just about do the samething, but this one is in a class all
its own..Just being the Unicorn makes it special, watching the wings flap,walk, talk etc.

The only soft part on this , is it's tail and Maine, But this toy is not a cuddle toy, although very cute.
It walks better on the kitchen, and dinning room floor, then on the thick carpet,

Includes a short life battery for just trying..It takes 2 AAA and 4 AA batteries

I recommend this Vtach unicorn. Your child will love it, and this will keep them excited, & busy.

title: Great, Fun toy for the one yr old, up to 3..This toy will Not Disappoint.
text:
The VTech toys are a good price, and do last a long time. We have Not had any of them break.
It seems most of these toys all do the same thing. There all about learning the samething.
Some light up, some talk.Ride, push it, Pull it, push button's. lights, This one does do it all.
With repetition the toddlers learn pretty fast.

My one year old granddaughter loves this toy, and being she is the second child (sister 2 yrs older) she does
have allot of other toys to play with. But she seems to go to this one.
Maybe cause this one she can ride it, and push it, or take it apart.. Other toys like this, do not give you the ride option also..
This takes a 2 AA batteries.
Allot of bright colors also.
Opening the box looked like allot to put together. My husband is Not handy, and only yelled a little putting this together!!

I do recommend this toy. Allot of fun for a one year old. It says its also up to 3 yrs.

title: Great toy for a 2 yo, that thinks he can Sing Loud.
text:
The two year old would not stop singing, playing with this.
He even took it up on the couch to display his singing ability, which sucked.
Its ok, cause he is Adorable, and we all got a good show.
The bottom lights up with all different colors, which he kept stomping on, and singing.
The mike comes off to just hold it.

The only draw back is, this is not that loud , but I guess it didn't have to be, cause the
2 year was singing LOUD..

title: Cute, sounds real, hard body, not cuddly.
text:
The cat is cute, the noise's that come from this cat by just walking by it sound's Real, but if your buying this for a a young child to cuddly this cat you will be disappointed.

Yes the outer material is soft, but with all the automation this cat has under the fake type fur , with NO padding, makes it Hard. Even the ears, legs, whole body is hard, But the tail is soft.
I think A child at least 2 yrs and up would like to play with this.

The Kiddy cats noise sounds real. The head moves allot while making noise, and expressions. The mouth does not move.
The cat when its happy is purring, & mewing.
The eye brows move a bit when the cat is angry, and he/she hisses. Cute. The eyes are huge, kind of scary looking, but the kids like it.

It only shows it is for little girls, All pinkish box , and the box only show's a girl playing with it.
I got this kiddy for a 7 yr old boy to have cause his Mother is going to have surgery. I thought it will give him something different to do instead
of him using his phone & ipad for games. Also thought he would like to sleep with this, but its Not cuddly.
But he seems to like this cat, as he has wanted a real kiddy for a long time.

Love the idea of this cat, but for this price (50.00) why didn't did the Manufacture put a thick padding under the fur,to make this cuddly, but leave little openings to let the sounds out etc.
Btw the sounds are loud.

The cat measures 12 inch tall..Nice size.
If I could give this a 3 1/2 star If I could, so I'm giving this 4 stars cause the child does like it.

title: Kids Love this, its fun and safe. Tires should have been rubber or something else!
text:
The Power wheels Blazer is So much Fun for the kids..Its not only keeping them busy, but me also!!..
This weighs 50 lbs, so its a stable rid for the 2 and 3 yr old.
It was pretty easy to put everything on this, and the stickers. You have to put the steering wheel on, the light bar, decals etc.
The wheels came already on,which made it easy getting this big truck out of the box.
I laid the box on its side, opened that end, and wheeled it out, instead of having to lift this 50 lb truck out of
the box..
Even my 7 yo grandson loves this and thinks its cool looking.

The problem I have with this is, we live on 9 ac, and for the kids to go around the big dirt driveway that is Not level, it does not work
very well, cause the tires are Plastic! So there is not much traction at times.
Although this goes pretty fast for young kids.
The kids are still getting the hang of steering this. If we do not watch them, they will go into a tree!

That said, we follow the kids from behind, have to give this truck a shove to get it up slight incline No problem when
there going down. Once they take there foot off the pedal the truck will stop.
Its cute with the gas pedal on the floor. The other electric bike we have has a button to press on the handle bar, so the 2 yo was using his toe instead of his thumb to make it go !!

Now he has the real deal with this truck.Pedal on the floor.
There is some room in the back for the child to put a toy back there. Or if you do not put the light bars on etc.
there might be room for another child to sit there! Have not tried that yet, so do not know if the battery is strong enough!

The battery last for a longer time then we expected without slowing this really down.
Its better to wait for the battery to become almost dead before recharging.It will last longer.

Any child would love this.I think you get allot of truck for the money..
This makes a great Birthday gift, and Xmas..
All the kids Love this Truck, and they know it from seeing it on tv.
Its a Big Hit.

title: Easy and fun for the kids. I take this out on the grass for the kids to paint.
text:
This is a regular size Barbie doll.
What is great about this Barbie Doll is, the kids get a fast reward using this spin art, and have a fun time.

Lay down Barbies dress in the little spin machine. Push the button, use a drop or so of the different colors, and out
comes a cute Dye Die Barbie dress.
Do not start using the same color to start out with, or everything will look just about the same. Change the colors around as it spins.
The dresses can be washed out and reused. I put them in a little bowl of water with a drop of soap. Wash the soap out, let them dry in the sun, or inside the house.

My 3 yo and 7 yo Grandkids love this. The 7 yo is a boy, and has fun with this also.
I take this outside, put down news paper, and let the kids go with this..Easy clean up.

Btw this does Not take any batteries. It is manual. Its about time!

I'm giving this a 4 star, as I think for the money this should have come with more and different color paints, and another dress or two.
It comes with 3 dresses, and 3 paints.

title: Exciting for our 3 yr old. Very cute, and fun.( after 4 days it's now boring!)
text:
The Magic flying Carpet is exciting for my 3 yr. She knows about this from TV, and was happy to get it.
The dolls are a good size and very cute. The eyes are big , but do Not move.The arms and legs move.
Allot of sparkle and shine. Colors are great.
The Carpet looks like its magic, and is a good size. .

The Carpet flutters. You have to hold it up to get a better view, and make believe, and when you do it talks etc.
The carpet rolls on a hard floor, but not great on carpet.

This gets your child to learn making believe, talk to the dolls.
It has music, talks, and is fun.

That said, I think its a pricey, that is why the 4 stars.
I'm now giving this a 3 star, as the 3 yo is getting bored with this toy after 4days. The child normally does make believe
For a long time with her toys, but not much with this one, or is it her age!!!

title: Well made, keeps the 3 yr old busy, songs etc. Its a 5 star
text:
A 3 year , and I would say up to 5 will be captivated with this toy. Be prepared for a bit of fun noise with this Thomas remote control Train.
The voice that comes from this toy is clear and a child can understand it. Its not baby talk, its kids talk.

The remote takes 2 AAA alkaline batteries, but Thomas comes with the 4 AA.

Our granddaughter that is going to be 3 in Aug went right for it, and understood the remote right away. Our grandson that is going to be 2 in Aug did not get it right, but since she took control of it, he didn't have a chance!!!
This is a good size Thomas train , not a wimpy little toy. It measures about 8 inch wide, and 5 inches tall.3 1/4 inches deep‚Ä¶The Guitar remote is really cute, and the buttons to press are kid friendly. Big enough for little chubby fingers.

When the songs come on, the 2 yo dances to it, as he see's in the Thomas train on Tv.
Anything that is Thomas Train the kids love. We also have the Thomas train tent that is shaped like the train. Now the kids are putting it all together for playing.
Its allot of fun, and kids learn dexterity with there fingers using the remote, plus the songs and action.

title: The kids love this Quad, battery last a long time.
text:
This was fairly easy to put together. Although my husband is Not Handy! It probably took him 30mins!

My 21 month old grandson got the hang of this right way. That said he is 35 lbs, and tall. This gave him a fun ride.
He did not want to get off and share with his cousin!
He rode On the carpet and outside on the walk ways..We live on a few acres , and there is allot of dirt, hills, Big boulders and rocks here.
From what one reviewer said, put a helmet on the child as the rocks makes the Quad fall backwards!
Since we did not have a helmet yet he has not gone on the rocky hill part of the property, So I really do not know
if this will fall back on him!

My almost 3 yr old Granddaughter is slimmer, and is tall, but she rides this all over and loves it.

This does not go in reverse, but the child can move it around and keep riding.
The batterie has lasted longer then expected, and charged very good for a little battery.
It does not go real fast , which I think is good for the little ones.

The almost 3 yr put the stickers on and had a great time doing it.
Great toy, or gift..

title: Works ok, needs more balls, and price has double in a month!
text:
My 1 1/2 yo Grandson liked this for a short time. About 5 mins..
I notice this Pop Corn toy does not always Pop, cause there should be more
balls it.
If there was more balls, the balls would be able to go into the little hole that moves up, and makes the balls Pop.

I bought this in March-2016 for $8.47, and now in April less then a month I have had this, its $15.70..
It more then doubled in price. Do I think its worth the price double, No!

title: Lots of things to do, Fun for our 2 1/2 yr old, and our 6 month old..Will last a long time.
text:
Fisher price did it again. Although this is a different type of toy.
It's more of a make believe toy that kiddos can play by them selfs or with friends.

This takes about 21 screws to put this together with a Phillips screw driver. Although It did go pretty easy.
This does not come with the batteries.

My 2 1/2 yr old Granddaughter loves playing make believe with this. When you open the door, the porch light goes on , on the other side of the door, is another porch light, that you can turn off and one with a big purple plastic light switch. Under that out door light is a cute mail box, with plastic letters, in different color's you can put other toys into the mail box.
Then there is allot of different music that plays.
To be honest, I found the songs where not that clear!

This toy is also fun for our 6 month old Grandsaughter. she loves the lights, music, pushing little things back and forth that she can reach.
This is toy made to last, as all Fisher Price toys are. We have yet to break any of them. its very sturdy, and does not fall over easy. Although it can it the child pushes against it.

You will not be disappointed, and I notice the price is going down!

title: Highly recommend this play Yard/ Porta Crib etc.
text:
We love this Cosco Play yard/ Porta Crib, and this can also be used to hold toys.

One of The best thing about this play yard etc. is the convenience and safety of it. Its easy to open and close.
In the middle of the crib there is a plastic piece that you pull up and it breaks down the whole crib.
Then you take the mattress and wrap it around the crib and velco it together and it can be put away. Its not heavy and fits away in small places.
This port a crib is excellent for all kinds of trips. And its safe as well for the little ones.
It has breathable mesh nets on all sides of the crib also.
The 1 1/2 year yo, and 2 /1/2 year also like to put a blanket over the top, bring there toys inside, and use this as a little fort..

title: A great toy, no disappointment here for your child.
text:
This is an Amazing toy that I would think any child from a year old would love this.
My 15 month old grandson loves the lights, and all the noises this makes.
Pull down the dog bone, the doggie pops up, and lights go on. Every time you turn a plastic page in the book, it has something
to say, and then some more.

Everything a child touches it comes alive with lights, and talks about it.
Push down the cats paw, and it lights up and twills around.
The lady bug does not move unless you move it.
So much activity a child will not get bored, and a child can play with this with other children at the same time, standing or siting.

Buy this your child will Not be disappointed.

title: Made well,Its a winner, kids are loving this.
text:
This is a 5 star winner for the kids.
There are 6 Die cast hot looking trucks.
A Cannon Blaster crusher, and Turbo Launcher.

The Trucks we got are different then the picture shows, but it doesn't make a difference.There are so cute.
The trucks are bout 2 1/2 inch long, chubby with Big Tires.
The detail and the way there painted, is so cute.
I have to say, I didn't know about the "Blaze and the Monster Machines".!
Even the 3 yr old is having a fun time shooting Trucks out of the Launcher.
When you press the launcher it makes a car noise then it can shoot out, and does go fast on the carpet , wood floors.
Or Patio.

Be warned, these are Not easy getting everything out of the packing. There clipped down underneath.

title: Fun bike, but plastic tires are not good for the Dirt!
text:
When My Two year old Granddaughter saw this Radio Flyer Red Trike, her eyes lite up,BIG smile on her face,and she was speechless, for a Second!..
It is good looking. Very cute. She loves it.

Although the Plastic tires are a disappointment with out groves in them. Since we live in the mountain, (as they do) on a few acres, the only cement to ride this on is our walkways around the house,
I Then thought she could ride this Radio flyer trike on our long loop Dirt drive-way, but its a bit hilly and the plastic tires are not good for traction on the Dirt, or any light mud going up a hill.
The wheels spin. With out traction its not as fun for her as I thought it would be. We have to push her around in some places.
The good part about the plastic tires are,they will not be popped by the stickers that
pop the other bikes the older kids ride around here.

It was easier putting the Trike together then it was getting the box open, and that is no exaggeration ! It wasn't taped together, it was Glued,
and two boxes the Trike came in, It certainly is not damaged.
This comes with very good detailed instruction how to put this together..If my Husband can put this together anyone can.

The little storage compartment in the back is durable plastic, and adorable for girls or boys. My Granddaughter put her dolly in there, with
some other goodies.
The seat will adjusts.

If you live in a area with sidewalks, or have a Large deck the kids will love ridding this Trike, or even on level grass.

I just want to mention, make sure your children have shoes on. I bought a larger Radio flyer for my older grandson (4yr) and he kept
hitting his toes on the cement when peddling . They gave that bike away in less then a month. (his toes where bleeding). They lived in Hawaii, and he was usually bare-foot.

title: Baby Alive does Allot more then other dolls do, and its fun for our 2 yr old.
text:
Baby Alive is Amazing. My two year old Granddaughter loves her.
The doll is Big , almost 14 /1/2 inch tall. With a big head, BIG eyes and Open Mouth! (kind of strange)
This also comes with Brown hair.
Speaks english or spanish. I'm thinking maybe a child that speaks english, can learn to speak some spanish with this doll!
Squeeze her hand and she speaks Allot. Her voice is loud and can be understood.

The food that comes with this is like Plato, and it says it contains Wheat.

I gave this to my 2 yr old granddaughter, who just had a baby sister this labor day, as we said this is a present from
your baby sister.That went over Great.
My Granddaughter Loves this Doll, Loves to feed it, and she rolls out the plato to make her food,
Baby alive chews the food, But be ready when your child changes the diaper. The play poop is a bit of a mess in small pieces.
Put down a little receiving blanket, or hand towel under the dolls tush so you do not have to pick up the little pieces of play food.
The doll is easy to underdress, & dress. This doll is keeping my Granddaughter busy, and she try's to copy her mother taking care of there new baby.

I think this would make a fun Birthday gift, or holiday gift , or just a nice present.
It says 18 months or older. I think 18 months is a little young!

It comes with starter batteries that do Not last long. It uses 3 AA. batteries.

title: Fun toy that keeps the kids busy and Learning.
text:
Wonderful fun toy for my 12 month old Grandson, and my 2 yo Granddaughter likes it also (maybe because he likes it!!)
This is a real activity center, and you cannot lose the toys on the bottom in the toy box. There all connected on the top of
the table, except the Phone.
The Phone is fun, its like the old type cell phone. There are buttons to press, lights, and a steering wheel that controls the teddy bear,
as it goes around.
Lights and Action with this toy. Its also colorful.

If your child is younger, you do not have to put he legs on. Just leave it on the floor for them.
This is nice for two kiddos , as one can be on the other side,if they do not want to share !!

Good for motor skills. Great toy that keeps the kids busy, and learning..
You will not go wrong buying this learning table.

title: A  special Wooden fun toy.
text:
What a wonderful different toy for a 4 month old and older.
My Two year old Granddaughter played with this for almost a hour, and also my 1 year old Grandson, found this very
intriguing , as he moved around the beads through the Maze.
Also since she is two she is bossy, so the one year just went to the other side of the toy to play.

From any angle all around the child has something to do with bright colors, and beads.
The beads go all through the curly thick colored wires , up, down, in circles. Little flowers that move.

I would not let a child use this to try and stand up, it will topple over. But you do not
have to put the tree type bottom on, and the child can sit and play.

Its All wood, and such nice craftsmanship. I think this is a special toy, that is Not plastic from China.
This toy will be handed down in my family for the other children to enjoy

This also makes a very nice baby shower gift, or when you go see a new special baby. ( it is a bit pricey).
Its is Bigger and heavier then I expected.

I recommend this toy,

title: Talks, does wheelies, fun.
text:
This is nice size truck, but from what other reviewer said, I thought this was going to be monster size, its not. Although has Big Wheels.
Just to get this out of the package, turn it upside down, and there will be full instructions, turning knobs, and all etc, to get this truck out of the box.

The truck is fun, it does a few different types of wheelies, it spins around and talks to you.
My 2 Yo Granddaughter that is Very Girlie loves this truck. So a truck is not always about the Boys.
It goes pretty Fast, and she is having a great fun time pushing buttons, moving all the goodies on this truck..

My 6 1/2 yo Grandson, Likes it but got bored fast with it.. I think he is too old for it..He is more into his Lego's

If you have a child that likes a good size truck, that talks, does stunts, this is the toy , He/She will like it.

If this had some type of remote, I would give this 5 stars.

title: Good toy for traveling, its fun , but not for a 5 yo.
text:
First I have to say this is a great toy to take with you on a vacation, outside etc.
Its very well contained, easy clean up, no tiny parts.

The top part of the table that holds the part where you build on, has a lock that keeps all the blocks (so to speak) underneath,
so they do not fall all over. Which also keeps it all together after playing.

The legs come down with a push of a button for each one of them..
For this price I think it should have come with more builders megabloks underneath.
My 1 yo, and 2 yo grand children liked playing with this, but I think a 5 yo would would get board with this..Not enough stimulation.

Its a cute toy, and seems sturdy.

title: 11 mo. old, and 21 month old love this.
text:
Just received this today.
My two grandkids where here when it arrived..One is 11 mos. the other is 21 mos.

I only had to put the handle bar on by pushing it into place.
I had to put two AA batteries in the side of this toy. Use a screw driver for one screw. Very easy. This does not come with the batteries.
Someone said you have to put stickers on..Not on mine, all stickers are already put on.

The 11mo old loved the buttons and all the sounds. Walked around it and started to push it.
There is a button that makes all the sounds louder, or softer.
The 21 mo old took over right away. Got on right away and rode this all over the house. Also liked the buttons and sounds.
Both children loved this toy, and it kept them busy and happy for a long time..

The 11 month old weighs 26 lbs, and the 21 mo old weighs about the same.
I would say this is for all size young children of about this age.

The front has two little wheels on either side, But the back has one big wide wheel, that is 7 inches wide..Seems to not wobble.
This toy measures 23 1/2 in long.
Floor to seat 8 in.
Seat is 5 1/2 in wide, 9 in long front to back.

title: Boring, and does not hold the child's interest for long.
text:
I, and My 2yr Granddaughter Tried to spend more time playing with this, and its Boring, and does not always catch the Train Ball to have it
go into the elevator. Then you have to push the ball out, and put it on top of the elevator to bring it back up, to only have it roll back down.
its very repetitious..
The ball goes down fast.
There are two chutes on the top, if you put the train ball in the other chute it just drops to the bottom!

Does not hold the child's interested for long.
Although its cute looking, that is why I gave it 2 stars.

title: Fun toy for 6 mo old to at least 2yrs..Love it.
text:
Fun toy for 6 mos to 2 yrs old.
My 10 mo old. and my 19 mo old Grand children Love this toy. So much, I might be buying another one.
Good price for allot to do with one toy .
Great toy to take with you out of the house. It keeps the kids buzy, its not too big.

Good for hand and eye coordination.And learning colors.
Press the toast down, then move the ball in front of it and the toast pops up.
Push the blender on the top and it starts going around, With lights, sounds, balls are jumping around, and talking..
Push the banana, Strawberry, Orange , and it says what it is, then more music.
Makes allot of different types of singing music for the kids
I could go on about this fun toy, as this has allot to offer , and keeps the little one's busy.

I highly recommend this..

title: This is a great toy for a baby that is a few months ...
text:
This is a great toy for a baby that is a few months old, and is starting to grab for toys,
and the colors are bright.

I thought this ball would be bigger, but it is for a baby, and he loves it. 4 1/2 months old.
There is a Bell inside the ball that makes noise when the baby grabs it.
And all the bright colors that babies are attracted too. Its easy for the baby to grab onto this ball.

The reason for the 4 stars. Its made in China.
All of these Baby Einstein toys are made in china, so it makes me wonder about the plastic there all made from!!!
But it looks like we do not have a choice from what I can find.
If anyone knows of teething toys or baby toys not made in China, Please Share..

title: Perfect snuggle doll for young child of any age.
text:
I have never heard of Madame Alexander Babies before, "Unfortunately" ..
But so glad I did now, Thanks to Amazon.

This little Dolly/baby is perfect for a one year old and up.
She is not to heavy, and a very good size to shlep with a child, or mommy/ daddy can put this in babies bag.

The blue eyes close when she is laid down, which the children like. The body is a soft material to cuddle with that a child
can Hug, snuggle with while sleeping, and drag around with her..
The head is a soft smooth type of neoprene/plastic that holds its shape,, with real looking features, and a little bit of hair, but a bald baby.

The clothes she is wearing are soft, and a child can take off and on. Although I think the child would
be a little more then a 1 yo..!

Children Love this Dolly, and it could last for the next Generation...
Pass it on.

Two thumbs up.

title: Pegs fall threw! Although Cute toy.
text:
Disappointed.
This is a very cute wood Porcupine with great colors for children.
But 7 of the 8 wooden pegs fell through with just one little tap when my year old granddaughter used this the very first time!
When I put them back in, some started to slid through!

The pegs are not really round, there octangular. So I would think they would stay in place till a child hits them with the cute little hammer this comes with.

There is some-type of glue in spots around the inside of each hole. Some holes have more glue then others. I'm guessing the glue is to keep the pegs in so they do not fall threw!

There is also a hole on the front part of the wood to put a little rope in for the child to pull this around..
Although this does Not have wheels.

Gave this two stars, cause it is so darn cute.
Made In China.

title: Allot of fun for a 5 yr old..
text:
Just gave this to my 5 yo. Grandson.
He loved it.

It comes with 10 round light weight rubbery but ridged disc's.. Only 5 of them fit in the Blaster at a time . You have to open the top where the spider is to put in the discs..
It took him a few times to be able to open it.
The disc sails off far depending how you aim this, Aim high it sails farther...
My Grandson used it in my livingroom that is 20 by 30, and it can shoot farther then 20 feet.

This was not too heavy for him to hold and shoot with one hand. Your hand goes threw two types of straps at the bottom of the blaster to hold in place.
Of course it would have been more fun if he had two of these to play with a friend..
This is also fun if your in a swimming pool , cause the disc's would float.

Fun toy..Good to give a young friend for a birthday present etc.

title: 5 yo, Grandson liked it for a short time.
text:
My 5 yr, grandson is into the Action figures right now. So he thought it was great, but only for a short time.
That said, it really does not do much, and I think he got bored.
My Grandson said he needs the other action figures Of Max Steel so he could play with them all together, and
interact with each other!

It close's down into it self with a crank on his chest, then folds back up.
The gun kept shooting off as soon as you put the bullet thing into it. It would not stay inside the gun.
That was disappointing.
Although It seemed to be a sturdy toy.

title: Don't waste your money.
text:
This was one of the Christmas presents I bought my 5 yr old Grandson.
The main reason I bought this was for the Microscope..Which I do not see here in this picture!

The Microscope was SO Weak it did nothing. You could use a cheesy magnifier, and get better results, or at least
see something a little bigger.

Since the microscope was not good, all the cards, and other little things in this, did not make a difference to use them.
This was Very disappointing, and certainly not fun for the child.

Later My Son-in-law went out and bought the child a nice Microscope that was fun for a 5 or 12 yr. old.

This is also way over priced for what it is, although it's cute!

title: The Instructions are a waste of time.
text:
I got this for my 5 yr old Grandson, that has a couple of Transformers at home.
This one was a waste of time , as the instructions are small drawings on a piece of paper, which
did not give any directions how to put together. The pictures where light in color and it was hard
to tell what fit together and what did not!!

After trying to hook on the shield and a couple of cheap plastic parts, it was not much fun. One of the plastic parts would
not even hook in together.
As far as making the truck and other fun things, this is suppose to do, they would not come together.
It was hard to figure this out!

When my older grandkids came over, they even thought it
was frustrating !

This Beast Hunter Transformer got thrown in the big box and put away.
Maybe in another year he might like it..As for now, NO..

I gave it a two star for the work and colors that went into this toy!

Very disappointed.

title: 4 1/2 loves this toy.
text:
If you have a child that loves Dino's , this will be fun.
My grandson is 4 1/2, and loves anything that is Dinosaurs .

This is made to fold up and is fun for the child to take to a friends house /park, and play with this.
You have to escape the Dino, from eating cars , but they do escape out of the tail, and make a run for it.
There are a few different ways to play with the dino..
Dino eats the cars & trucks that come with this,and poops them out the tush..Kids get a great laugh!
You try and trap the dino in the cage, push the handles down fast, now you have a trapped dino.
This goes with the other Matchbox toys. You can add on by buying other match box..

title: 3 1/2 yr old , loves this. Well made
text:
My 3 1/2 yr old grandson loves this Komodo Dragon. The only toys he really likes are Dino's, and Komodo's.
He calls his game playing, Playing with his Buddy's..
I think this Komodo is a fun make believe toy.

As you can see from the pictures that QueenoPearls has put up. It is life like. With allot of
details to the body, face etc.

It is kind of a soft rubber. It is not as small as it looked from the picture on Amazon.

For the money this is a great buy. While in Hawaii recently, and going to a big toy store there,
I bought a hard type of Plaster Komodo for more money, and it doesn't come close to the details, size, and feel that this one does.

Two thumbs up on this Komodo Dragon

title: Kids love this truck
text:
Another Tonka Truck that is fun for the kids, and it's Sturty.
I sent this to my 3 year old Grandson.He loves it.

He doesn't seem to get bored with this truck. Its not just a truck to
zoom around. With all the big peices to make it work its been fun for him.
It keeps him buzy.

More then one child can play with the truck together.
It teaches young children to share, and use there motor skills,
and figure out where to place the peices to make sounds, and
do different types of fun things.

So far he has not gotten bored.

title: He got bored with it fast!
text:
My 2 1/2 yr old Grandson. Got bored with this train tent real fast!

My Daughter put it way, and will bring it out in a few months. Maybe he will like it better!
Maybe he got borned, because he likes jumping on a big trampoline better.
Since they live on the beach in Hawaii, he is in the ocean, and running on the beach all day.
Maybe this is why he finds this tent boreing!!

It seems to be made will..I thought it was cute. He also had a hard time getting in and out, for some reason!! I noticed he would lift the whole train up and get inside..
He also might be too young for it!

title: This is not a good quality puzzle
text: This puzzle was smaller than described. Also colors were phony, and puzzle pieces were very thin. This is not a good quality puzzle.

title: Three Stars
text: This puppy is much smaller than it  looks

title: Hard to assemble
text: The very first step was difficult. I suggest pulling up a YOuTube video about assembling big wheels to help. My husband also had to get his drill out and was pushing some parts together with every ounce of strength and still he was struggling. Some of the holes were sealed shut so he needed the drill to help push through the plastic. It's sturdy now that it's put together but I wouldn't recommend others to get one and I would be hesitant to ever purchase another one.

title: Cute and fun magnets!
text: Super cute, lots of animals to choose from, they only peel on the edges if you've got a kid who sucks on them‚Äîso I keep them away from the baby, but my daycare toddlers love them!

title: Great gift
text: Perfect for toddlers who are rough with toys and it's easy for them to see how pieces fit.

title: Not impressed
text:
This is much smaller than I thought it would be. Comes about just above my ankle in height lol
It doesn't spray water very far and it struggles to stay upright. I would have been better off just hanging the hose over a tree branch and letting it flow from there.

title: Giftable to Hazardous people
text: Definitely want to have the right people to play this with...probably not your religious grandparents...but it's hilarious. Prepare to spit out drinks/food.

title: too thin and it broke right away
text: didn't even last.  it broke right away.  Big disappointment for children.  A waste of money.

title: Fun to do
text: It was a fun way to pass time and came out so cute!

title: Cute!
text: A little hard to paint underside

title: Did the job
text: A little stiff

title: Hard material
text: Cute but a little harder than I expected

title: Good for dog poop
text:
As bad as the title sounds, it's actually a good thing. We had a dog that was having health problems and couldn't hold it for long. So we were cleaning up a lot of poop. I have a bad back and a lot of difficulty bending over because of it. This scoop (we got the blue one if it matters) had a reasonably long handle so I wouldn't have to bend over as far, yet short enough that I wasn't just pushing the poop around. It was scooping up just fine.

I don't know if this is the type of comment that would encourage or discourage buyers for getting it. So I was just honest. Whether you use it for poop, sand, or something else, it is a product that I am impressed with and would definitely buy again (not for the same reason, thank goodness!).

title: power bingo
text: so far all that participate in our bingo games are quite pleased with the new wheel it works much better than a bowl full of bingo balls. thanks for fast deliver  and your care about our likes or dislikes.

title: Very cute and great quality.
text: A really cute variety of robots, my 5 year old loved it. Plenty of cupcake toppers and the happy birthday comes already strung up which is always a huge plus/ less work!

title: Already need a new sword
text: The most important piece, the sword, was easily  broken so now we can't properly transform him without it.

title: very cute!
text: songs are cute and price was good, my 15 month old likes it but doesn't spend a ton of time playing with it.  got one for a gift too, overall a good stacking toy.

title: we love Green Toys!
text: we have a lot of Green Toys, they are cute, very durable and well priced. This one has been in our tub for awhile now; it drains easily and both kids (ages 5 and 1) love playing with it.

title: have purchased multiple
text: We love Melissa & Doug stuff.  Got these on lightening deal so even better!

title: we love Green Toys!
text: have and will continue to purchase green toys for my kids.  very affordable, cute, durable and well made.

title: we love Green Toys!
text: have and will continue to purchase green toys for my kids.  very affordable, cute, durable and well made.  colors and toy are great.

title: we love Green Toys!
text: Have and will continue to purchase green toys for my kids.  very affordable, cute, durable and well made.  my 13 month old loves to carry around the little bear conductors and the book is great.

title: Grandkids love it!
text: Purchased to add onto the Thomas train set.  Grandkids love it!

title: Really neat crayons!
text: My preschool daughter is too heavy handed so Im mostly using these for me until she has more control. It has a texture of lipstick and so it glides on smooth. I really like how versatile this is. In the meantime, she will use other crayons since these aren't cheap.

title: Cute
text: It works well. Kids love it. Just step on it to activate sounds

title: Small
text: I bought this as a gift for my toddler Goddaughter for Christmas. It ended up being MUCH smaller than I thought it would be. Its small enough for a big baby doll. For the price, it was disappointing. But the keys work so that's good

title: Malfunction
text: This is a great toy for toddlers and kids, there are lights and cars involved. There is supposed to be music involved but after installing new double A batteries(that I had to provide myself), only the lights work. The one I purchased makes no sound. That's disappointing

title: It's ok
text: I bought this as a stocking stuffer for my child with sensory issues. It came in a pack of one and was a random color. Luckily it ended up being the red, which is his favorite color. I can see it being useful as a timer, as a calmer, or just to play with. My son is 5 but my 2 year old plays with it too.

title: Cute skirts
text: These are great for costume or daily use to have a little extra flair. I bought these for my 6yo daughter on her birthday and upon opening, they were stiff. shedding, and smelled really bad. After washing them, they were softer, smelled much better and stopped shedding. Some of the stars, however, will get lost in the wash and attach themselves to other clothing so I'd advise to wash them separately

title: Die cast
text: My 3 year old loved it

title: Sent random car
text: I did not receive a Goofy car as pictured. What I got was a PINK MINNIE MOUSE CAR. FOR A GIRL. I have 3 sons. This is very disappointing

title: Cute but needs improvement
text: Cuuute little bubble maker. It makes a lot of bubbles but it doesn't last very long. The thing is, there's a design flaw: when the solution gets low, no bubbles come out and it pools at the bottom. There's no way to drain the remaining solution back into the bottle for storage. Other than those 2 things. It's a good little machine.

title: His fav gift
text: I bought this for my Godson on his 4th birthday. The recommendation says it's for older kids but this boy LOVES his new toy. It may be taller than him but it was so worth the purchase for him to say it was his fav toy from the party! WINNER! Only the best for my boo

title: One flaw
text: Exactly what my kid wanted for Christmas. It's his favorite toy. The only issue he's had with it is the dance feature doesn't really work. We've changed batteries twice and still nothing. Other than that, it's great

title: Get out your needle and thread
text: Nice and soft and it's what my kid wanted. However,  he keeps finding small holes in the seams that I have to hand sew back together

title: Too small
text: I bought this as a Christmas present for my 3yo daughter. I didn't realize how dang TINY it is. If I'd have known, I wouldn't have spent that much money on this(now a) stocking stuffer.

title: Too small
text: Although this bear is super cute, I ordered it with hopes of tying a ribbon onto it to make it into a Christmas ornament for my 1yo. I could probably still do that, but it is was smaller than expected so I'm not sure if it's what I was looking for. A bit expensive for the size.

title: It's ok
text: It's a cute toy, I bought it for my 1yo who is obsessed with remotes. It didn't do much for him. Next time I think I will buy a ‚Äútrash‚Äù remote and let that be his toy

title: We love it
text: My 2.5 year old loves it. She told me the ocean chose her!

title: Excellent
text: 5 stars! My 7 year old(and his father and all his uncles and aunts) loved this gift from Santa. It was a big hit on Christmas, everyone was playing. And the fact that you can add more guns is perfect. Thank you! Quality product.

title: Best I've ever played
text: This game is the best monopoly I've ever played. I usually don't like Monopoly because it drags on and on and on. This one ends when the tower is full, and it gives a huge break to the ones that are losing. At any moment, fate can change. I can play this all day

title: Easter present
text: Cute back yard fun for kids. A bit overpriced IMO, but at least they enjoyed playing with it. Got it for an Easter present.

title: Perfect
text: This is a beautiful wooden set, great quality. My 2 year old loves to use it to put on her "makeup" like mom

title: A winner with the littles.
text: It was a bit stiff, even after washing, but my son loves it and takes it everywhere.

title: Cute
text: Toddler loves it. Stopped working for a couple weeks and then magically was fixed. I don't know. Is a cute idea though

title: Perfect
text: My 6 year old just had a dream come true when he opened this. It fits him great and he absolutely loves it. Great purchase

title: Perfect
text: 1.5 year old nephew fell in love with this toy. Very satisfied.

title: Perfect
text: My 21 month old loves her Peppa family toy collection

title: Precious
text: Adorable kitchen, my kids love it. It folds up for storage. That's my favorite part!

title: Cool!!
text: Nephew was very satisfied with the gift

title: Genius
text: Bought as a Christmas present for my 1.5 year old nephew. He loved being able to use his markers all by himself...and mom can rest easy knowing there will be no mess :)

title: So cute
text: A little smaller than expected. It's probably about 3.5 inches wide. Super cute though and I'm satisfied. Purchased for my 21month old for Christmas and she loves it.

title: Guy gift
text: Bought these to put in my husbands Easter basket, they're a hit! Hilarious prank to pull on friends, but can be used for strangers too. He went around his military base tagging the vehicles of his crew

title: Cute lamb
text: Cute little baby gift. After a wash or 2 the soft fur kind of shrivels up- not as fluffy anymore.

title: Awesome Bat Cave
text: A huge hit. My 5 year old got it for Christmas. He thanks me every single day. He loves it!!!

title: New version
text: It's ok. Not as great as the original game where there was a large variety of questions to ask to make the game last a little longer. Disappointed!

title: Great one!
text: Great costume for my 4 year old, he loves it! The mask is cheaply made with plastic and cracked in half. But there's another one you can buy separate on Amazon with eyes that light up for 8 or 9 dollars, worth the purchase!

title: Both Legos fit!
text: Regular Legos and Lego Duplos fit! Great for crafting a lego table top.

title: Both Legos fit!!
text: Regular Legos and Lego Duplos fit on these plates

title: A little big but still fun
text: Ran a little baggy and long in the legs for my 38" tall 33lb 4 year old boy. But he enjoys it anyway, at least he will be growing

title: omg, pefect
text: PERFECT gift ever for my 2 year old son! The wheels turn in every direction so he can be creative with his racer. It was a Christmas gift and I can hardly get this kid off of it, it's just his size!

title: Decent about of bubbles
text: Time of bubbles

title: Absolutely stunning!
text: This puzzle is absolutely stunning! The colors are vibrant, the picture realistic, and the pieces sturdy. I was a bit wary after our last two puzzles (from other companies) had pieces missing, but every last piece was in the box. There's also a real-scale print that comes with it, and when the going got tough at all the blue water, they slid it beneath the puzzle as a guide. 1,000 piece puzzle done in four days ‚ô•

title: Less than 500 pieces in the box
text: Sometimes going with the cheapest option isn't the best route.

title: Five Stars
text: I plan to buy another box of these next year for sure.

title: Five Stars
text: These are great! The kids love choosing which one they'll get.

title: They did not glow :(

title: Good Quality, Appropriate for Jigsaw Puzzle Experts
text:
This GLISTELLO 1000-PIECE JIGSAW PUZZLE FOR ADULTS--COLORFUL BOATS, MARSEILLED is a good quality puzzle, highly appropriate for jigsaw puzzle experts. It has many similar pieces that present a challenge to assemble, because they need to be placed by shape as well as by color.

The puzzle pieces are small, which makes the 1000-piece puzzle fit easily on a worktable. The fully interlocking pieces are thick enough to be handled easily, and the interlocking tabs don't bend if the pieces are handled with ordinary care. The pieces don't click together like a Ravensburger puzzle pieces, but they fit together unmistakably by feel when properly joined.

Unfortunately, the pieces don't fit tightly enough to allow joined sections to be picked up and moved without falling apart. Completed sections need to be picked up on a sheet of paper, or pushed along the tabletop, to reach their proper locations in the puzzle.

I wouldn't recommend this puzzle for group assembly, because of the many pieces that are visually similar in color and shape. Puzzles like this one require a lot of sorting of pieces in advance by color and shape if the actual assembly is to proceed quickly.

title: Highly Enjoyable for Jigsaw Puzzle Experts
text:
This ANTELOPE MOON JIGSAW PUZZLE (1000 Pieces, Round, No Dust; for Adults) is a highly enjoyable jigsaw puzzle for expert assemblers. The black and white picture, and the confusing moon crater lines, makes the assembly ‚Äúby picture‚Äù very difficult. However, the puzzle goes together in satisfying fashion‚Äìalbeit slowly‚Äìif you assemble it ‚Äúby the shapes of the pieces‚Äù.

The round puzzle shape also helps with assembly, because the interior pieces are curved differently on the inner and outer edges (inner being closer to the puzzle center). This is a puzzle that should only be gifted to a jigsaw enthusiast who welcomes challenger puzzles.

title: Not a ‚Äú3D‚Äù Puzzle‚ÄìPieces Are Standard Flat Pieces
text:
This SKSJK TRADE RED FORTUNE TREE JIGSAW PUZZLE (1000 Piece, 3D Puzzle for Adults) is ‚Äú3D‚Äù only to the extent that the flat puzzle pieces have a photo that makes the finished picture appear to have a textured surface. The puzzle pieces are of decent quality, in terms of thickness and printing, but they are loose-fitting.

Priced at $18.99 on Amazon, the puzzle compares to a Ravensburger jigsaw, but in anything other than price, it falls well short of the Ravensburger gold standard.

title: Fun for Experts Who Can Assemble Jigsaw Pieces by Shapes
text:
This BGRAAMIENS TWISTED LINES JIGSAW PUZZLE (1000 Pieces, Challenger, for Adults) is intended for jigsaw puzzle experts. It's fun for anyone who can assemble jigsaws by the shapes of the pieces as well as by the colors and images on the pieces.

The ‚Äúcheat‚Äù letters on the backs of the pieces help with assembly, if needed. They eliminate the problem that occurs with some very difficult jigsaws, when similarly shaped pieces seem to fit and throw off the total assembly process.

This puzzle isn't a good gift unless you are sure that the intended recipient loves extra-challenging jigsaws!

title: Beautiful Photo; Light-Reflective, Foil-Effect Lines Help With Assembly
text:
This SPIN MASTER NASA FOIL EFFECT JIGSAW PUZZLE (750 Pieces) shows the Orion Nebula Galaxy. It's a challenging jigsaw, but a beautiful photo that makes the assembly effort worthwhile.

You will need to use the shiny, light-reflective, foil-effect lines when you assemble the puzzle. Once you realize this, the assembly goes fast. The puzzle pieces are well made with substantial thickness, and are uniquely cut so that it's hard to place any piece in the wrong position if you're careful.

title: Ultra-Challenging But Unattractive Jigsaw
text: The problem with this ultra-challenging OPTICAL-PATTERN BLACK AND WHITE JIGSAW PUZZLE FOR ADULTS (1000 Pieces; (Black White Striped Lines, 28 x 20 inches) is that it's all black and white.  Ordinarily I love challenging jigsaws, but this ‚Äúpicture‚Äù wasn't attractive enough to justify all the effort required to assemble it.

title: Challenger Puzzle--Pieces Don't Click Together Solidly
text:
EDIT (7/3/21): Star rating downgraded from 3 stars to 2 stars. The photo provided in the box does NOT show sufficient detail in the very dark and blurry areas. Assembly requires constant squinting at individual pieces to find minuscule identifying features. This jigsaw took me 2 weeks to assemble, instead of my usual 5-6 days for a seriously challenging jigsaw.

This PUZZQUEST JIGSAW PUZZLE (1000 PIeces, ‚ÄúStroll‚Äù) is one of the most difficult jigsaw puzzles that I've ever encountered. It is difficult because (1) it has many similarly-colored pieces that are almost identically shaped; (2) the correct pieces do NOT click together solidly (unlike Ravensburger or other high-quality jigsaw puzzle pieces); and (3) at least half of the puzzle consists of out-of-focus greenery in dark, muddled colors.

In assembling the ‚Äúeasy‚Äù border and left side (in clear focus) of the puzzle, I must have made 15-20 incorrect joins that needed to be corrected later. Assembling by shapes is hampered by the similarity of neighboring pieces--absent a solid click-together, you can easily join two pieces incorrectly and build on them for a while before your error becomes apparent. The colors of the pieces will NOT alert you to the incorrect joins.

The puzzle is a very awkward size. It is very tall, so you have to stand up and lean over it to work on the top quarter. Be sure to measure your work area to make sure you have enough space to accommodate the height.

The only reason to buy this puzzle is to prove that you're up to any jigsaw puzzle challenge. To accommodate 1000 pieces, the photo is blown up so much that even the most distinct areas have several pieces. Thus the assembly is slow-going, and not particularly enjoyable. Pre-sorting the pieces doesn't help to speed things up, because half the puzzle consists of out-of-focus greenery in muddled dark colors.

title: Lots of Small Pieces Make for Fiddly Build
text:
This LEGO NINJAGO EMPIRE DRAGON 71713 NINJA TOY BUILDING KIT (286 Pieces) is a good choice for any LEGO Ninjago fan. Like all LEGO sets, it has step-by-step visual instructions that make assembly easy.

Note that this LEGO set has 286 pieces. Many of the pieces are small, so that the build is somewhat fiddly.

title: Good Quality, Appropriate for Jigsaw Puzzle Experts
text:
This GLISTELLO 1000-PIECE JIGSAW PUZZLE FOR ADULTS - DE HAAR CASTLE, NETHERLANDS (27.5 x 19.7 inches) is a good quality puzzle, highly appropriate for jigsaw puzzle experts. It has many similar cloud and tulip pieces that present a challenge to assembly, because the pieces need to be placed by shape as well as by color. Of course, jigsaw puzzle experts love these difficult jigsaws!

The puzzle pieces are small, which makes the 1000-piece puzzle fit easily on a worktable. The fully interlocking pieces are thick enough to be handled easily, and the interlocking tabs don't bend if the pieces are handled with ordinary care. The pieces don't click together like Ravensburger puzzle pieces, but they fit together unmistakably by feel when properly joined.

Unfortunately, the pieces don't fit tightly enough to allow joined sections to be picked up and moved without falling apart. Completed sections need to be picked up on a sheet of paper, or pushed along the tabletop, to reach their proper locations in the puzzle.

The puzzle picture looks exactly like the photograph on the product page. The picture is nicely printed on the puzzle itself, and on a big sheet packed inside the box for reference during assembly. The price (about $19 on Amazon) is very reasonable for a jigsaw puzzle of this size and quality.

I wouldn't recommend this puzzle for group assembly, because of the many pieces that are visually similar in color and shape. Puzzles like this one require a lot of sorting of pieces in advance by color and shape if the actual assembly is to proceed quickly.

title: Good Quality, Appropriate for Dedicated Jigsaw Puzzle Experts
text:
This GLISTELLO 1000-PIECE JIGSAW PUZZLE FOR ADULTS - BURANO, ITALY - VENICE (27.5 x 19.7 inches) is a good quality puzzle, but one for dedicated experts. It has many solid-colored pieces, and lots of blue pieces (sky and water) that are almost exactly the same shade of blue. These kinds of pieces must be assembled by shape, which greatly increases the difficulty of the puzzle. Even the border of this puzzle is difficult to assemble, because of all the similar-colored blue pieces.

The puzzle pieces are small, which makes the 1000-piece puzzle fit easily on a worktable. The fully interlocking pieces are thick enough to be handled easily, and the interlocking tabs don't bend if the pieces are handled with ordinary care. However, the small size of the pieces makes them harder to pick up during the pre-assembly sorting process. The pieces don't click together snugly like Ravensburger jigsaw pieces, but they fit together unmistakably by feel when properly joined.

Unfortunately, the pieces don't fit tightly enough to allow joined sections to be picked up and moved without falling apart. This is mildly annoying, because I like to turn questionably joined pieces over to check the fit from the wrong side--especially when the pieces are a solid color that requires assembly by shape.

The puzzle picture looks exactly like the photograph on the product page. There are large areas of bright color, and not much fine detail. The picture is nicely printed on the puzzle itself. The price (about $15 on Amazon) is very reasonable.

I like this puzzle, because I like to assemble extra-difficult jigsaws. However, I wouldn't recommend it for group assembly, because of the many pieces that are visually quite similar in color and shape. Puzzles like this one require a lot of sorting of pieces in advance by color and shape if the actual assembly is to proceed fairly quickly.

title: Challenging, High-Quality Jigsaw Puzzle for Expert Enthusiasts
text:
This FRED ‚ÄúMARSHMALLOWS‚Äù JIGSAW PUZZLE (Dan Saelinger, Artist; 500 Pieces) is a high-quality, fully-interlocking jigsaw puzzle. It's mostly made from recycled material, and printed with soy-based ink (both very good qualities in a cardboard product that will be used once or twice and then discarded in the trash).

The puzzle is made of cardboard that is thinner than the cardboard in a Ravensburger jigsaw puzzle. However, although Ravensburger puzzles represent the gold standard, the cardboard in the FRED puzzles is heavy enough to afford a quite acceptable puzzle-assembly experience.

As a fan of ‚Äúexpert‚Äù jigsaws that are challenging to assemble, I really love the ‚ÄúMarshmallows‚Äù picture. There are a lot of straight lines to help with assembly, but you have to look closely at the black areas on the individual puzzle pieces to place the individual marshmallows in their proper locations.

For a picture like this one, a 500-piece puzzle is difficult enough to challenge even the most experienced jigsaw puzzle enthusiast.

The puzzle comes in a sturdy, attractive storage box with a tight-fitting lid. The box will stack easily, and won't come open and spill the pieces if you drop the box.

title: Jigsaw Puzzle as Irresistible as Baby Yoda
text:
This BUFFALO GAMES STAR WARS TRADING CARDS PUZZLE (500 pieces) is irresistible--it has Baby Yoda in the center! Anyone who has watched ‚ÄúThe Mandalorian‚Äù (on the Disney Channel) will love putting it together.

Although Buffalo jigsaws aren't as nice as Ravensberger jigsaws--the Buffalo pieces are smaller and thinner than Ravensberger pieces--the Buffalo jigsaws are still high in quality. First, the interlocking pieces fit together tightly, so that you always know that you've found the correct piece. Second, the puzzle pieces are always printed well--sharply and in full color.

This puzzle comes in a small, square box (8‚Äù x 8‚Äù). The puzzle itself is 21.25‚Äù wide and 15‚Äù wide, so that it makes a good-sized picture and fits easily on a card table. The picture is easy enough to assemble, because of the many straight lines and white bands around the depicted trading cards.

The puzzle is one of a series of Star Wars puzzles manufactured by Buffalo. They range in size from 500 to 2000 pieces.

title: Simplistic Story, Scientific Water Experiments, Aimed at Young Girls
text:
I'm a big fan of the Thames & Kosmos building kits--especially the ones that teach STEM principles. However, this THAMES & KOSMOS PEPPER MINT IN THE FANTASTIC UNDERWATER SCIENCE VOYAGE EXPERIMENT KIT is definitely NOT one of my favorites. The experiments do teach about the physical properties of water (e.g., siphoning, hydraulics), but they are boring--mostly they require operating a syringe to push water through tubing.

The boat is easy to build. The parts are stamped onto thin sheets of wood. You punch the parts out of the sheets, and the edges come out smooth and clean. The parts then lock together without requiring glue or other fasteners. The assembly instructions are included in a booklet that contains a silly adventure/discovery story that features the girl character Pepper Mint.

The story is interrupted from time to time with instructions for science experiments. Each experiment has a good, easy-to-understand explanation of ‚Äúwhat's happening‚Äù (e.g., water can move things because, unlike air, it cannot be compressed).

The kit is apparently aimed at 11-year-old girls (Pepper Mint's age), but the story and the experiments seem rather simplistic for that age group. I do wish that Thames & Kosmos had chosen a more serious name than ‚ÄúPepper Mint‚Äù for their girl scientist. This kit has some teaching value, but it trivializes science for girls.

title: Works as Advertised; Very Young Child Will Need Some Adult Help
text:
This KANO HARRY POTTER CODING KIT works as advertised. It requires an app (Win10, FireOS, Android, iOS) for operation and play. (The Kano Code app for the iPad seems to work well.) The wand is fairly large--big enough to look and feel like a real magic wand.

The kit includes a booklet with instructions for assembling the wand. You insert batteries into a circuit board, put a button piece and the circuit board into a part of the wand, and close the wand with another piece. Adding the last wand piece is a bit tricky, but the finished wand looks nice and doesn't fall apart. A button on the end of the wand opens it up for battery changes. Two sets of batteries are included.

The app allows a child to create a Kano account, but sends an email to a parent's email address to allow the parent to set the child's privileges. The app opens to an illustrated map of the Hogwarts campus. The map has colored spots that you tap or select to open the ‚Äúchallenges‚Äù.

For example, an early challenge teaches the child to change the colors on a drawing of an owl. The coding is accomplished by dragging and dropping code blocks until they click together and add the color-changing capability to the wand.

As an adult who knows almost nothing about coding, I didn't fully understand how the coding blocks went together or how the wand was supposed to be used once a new coding feature was added. With a little more study time, I'm sure that I would have figured out how to do the coding. However, if the wand is intended for a very young child, an adult with minimal coding knowledge will probably be required to help the child get started.

The coding kit also includes a nice chart of the wand motions required to execute the spells used in the Harry Potter books and movies. This kit should keep a child busy for hours, if the child is motivated to learn to use the wand.

title: Projector Is Hard to Position, Works Over Short Distances; Stories Are Boring
text:
This MOONLITE STORYBOOK PROJECTOR (Special Edition Disney Gift Pack, for Ages 1 and Up) is a flawed concept. The projector is difficult to position over the flashlight on my Galaxy S10 phone, unless I turn the phone over and look through the lens at the light. This burns an image into my retina, and is clearly not good for my eyes!

The projector clips onto the phone, and exerts moderate pressure on the screen. I don't like this, because I worry about cracking the screen.

The projector works with the free ‚ÄúMoonlite‚Äù app (available from the App Store or Google Play). You will have to register for an account to use the app. After that, you must activate each set of story reels by entering an activation code--the code is on a small card packed in the box. You tap the ‚Äúunlock‚Äù icon at the top left of the app, and enter the code.

Once you've activated the story reel set, you click on the story you want. The app will then display a story for you to read to your child. As you read each page, you advance the reel in the Moonlite projector, to get a new illustration for each page of the story.

The projector shows a focused illustration (focus is adjustable), as long as you are no more than a yard or so away from the surface you are projecting to. You cannot project the picture across a room, or for any great distance, because the phone's flashlight isn't bright enough to project for long distances.

The photos that accompany the stories in the Disney set are boring, as are the stories. Kids will no doubt love the Disney characters in the pictures (e.g., Mickey, Minnie, Donald, Goofy), but the story illustrations are repetitious. Also the detail in the illustrations gets lost because the projected images are fairly small.

title: Big ‚ÄúMinecraft‚Äù Set Features Creeper Mine Locale
text:
Kids who love playing ‚ÄúMinecraft‚Äù will love this LEGO MINECRAFT THE CREEPER MINE 21155 BUILDING KIT (834 Pieces). It's one of the biggest sets in the LEGO ‚ÄúMinecraft‚Äù series--the series that brings various locales in the virtual ‚ÄúMinecraft‚Äù universe to life. The ‚ÄúMinecraft‚Äù sets can be joined together, and they use standard LEGO elements that are compatible with all regular LEGO sets.

A great feature is the twisty ‚Äúmine shaft‚Äù inside the Creeper Mine tower. You pour ‚Äúgold nuggets‚Äù (gold-colored studs) into the top, open a switch, and the ‚Äúnuggets‚Äù fall down an angled shaft into a treasure chest waiting below. (It reminds me of a coin sorter.)

The set has Steve, blacksmith, and husk minifigs, plus buildable Creeper, cow, and bat figures. There's a mine car that runs on rails, and TNT that blasts out bedrock.

This set is a bit trickier to build than other ‚ÄúMinecraft‚Äù sets, but it's a satisfying build. If you have a mobile device that is compatible with the ‚ÄúLEGO Life‚Äù app, you can download the building instructions for this set and build it from your tablet (rather than from the included printed instructions).

title: Kit Produces Great Monster Figure That Is Fun to Build
text:
This LEGO MARVEL SPIDER-MAN FAR FROM HOME MOLTEN MAN BATTLE 76128 BUILDING KIT (294 Pieces) is probably most appreciated by kids and adults who've watched the ‚ÄúSpider-Man Far From Home‚Äù movie that features Molten Man. However, the kit produces a great monster figure that is fun to build even if you haven't seen the movie.

The kit is compatible with standard LEGO sets, and has some elements that can be used very creatively in other models. For example, the two gold chains that hang from the figure's shoulders are unusual for the color. Another element that I really love is the fast-action stud shooter hand. (It shoots 6 studs in rapid succession as you turn the rotary gear part.) The gripper claw hand is also pretty cool.

The minifigs and their accessories are especially good. You get Spidey with an assortment of web weapons; a fireman with a buildable fire extinguisher; and a purple-caped Mysterio.

There are a lot of small elements in this set--which is why the piece count is so high. If you have a mobile device that is compatible with the LEGO Life app, you can download the building instructions and build the model using your mobile device rather than the printed instructions.

title: Large Model With Fold-Out Rapid Stud Shooter
text:
This LEGO MARVEL AVENGERS ULTIMATE QUINJET 76126 BUILDING KIT (838 Pieces) produces a large model (4‚ÄùH x 15‚ÄùL x 11‚ÄùW) with a lot of interesting play features. My favorite feature is the fold-out rapid stud shooter (6 studs launched when you turn the wheel!), but the stud-shooting trike that rolls out of the rear cargo hatch is a close second.

I also like the two compartments that open on the top of the quinjet to accommodate minifigures. The one in front is a regular cockpit, the one behind the cockpit is a passenger compartment. The model also has adjustable wings and rotors that spin.

A large model is always a satisfying build. This one has a lot of intriguing, innovative construction techniques. As always, the step-by-step LEGO instructions are crystal clear; if followed correctly, they will yield a rock-solid model for play purposes.

The building instructions for this set can be downloaded into the LEGO Life app. If you do that, you can build the model using your tablet instead of the printed booklet.

title: Great Movie Scene Kit That's Fun Even Without Seeing Movie
text:
This LEGO SPIDER MAN FAR FROM HOME: STARK JET AND DRONE ATTACK 76130 BUILDING KIT (504 Pieces) lets kids recreate scenes from the ‚ÄúSpider Man Far From Home‚Äù movie, but it's a great set all by itself. There are enough pieces to make it a satisfying build (moderate difficulty), and it's fun to play with even if you haven't seen the movie.

My favorite feature is the bomb hatch located behind the pilot/passenger compartment that seats the minifigs. You can seat Spidey in the hatch, press a button, and let him drop down on his web string to dangle beneath the plane. You can also use the hatch to drop brick-built energy bombs. Behind the hatch, there is another compartment that opens for storing bombs and weapons.

The two little drones are quick to build. The drones and the Stark jet are all equipped with stud shooters. (Stud shooters are special spring-loaded bricks that shoot off single studs that were loaded onto them, when you move a lever.)

The jet has a minimum of stickers (always a good thing, in my opinion). The ‚Äúadjustable wings‚Äù are the two upper ones at the tail. They can be adjusted to different angles. The big wings at the sides, and their wingtips, are fixed in place.

The kit includes minifigs for Happy Hogan, Nick Fury, Spider-Man, and Mysterio, as well as their associated weapons.

title: Police Car's LIght/Sound Brick Makes Simple Set Special
text:
This LEGO DUPLO TOWN POLICE STATION 10902 BUILDING KIT (38 Pieces) is an inexpensive building set intended for very young children (age 2+ and up). The DUPLO sets contain large building blocks that children with developing motor skills can handle--they are NOT compatible with standard LEGO sets.

This set adds a police station to the DUPLO Town series. The station is a shallow ‚Äústorefront‚Äù, but the jail cell has a little toilet, which is a nice touch. The cell door opens and closes, so that the crook can be locked up. The police car has a special brick for lights and a siren sound (activated by pressing a button--no batteries required).

I don't understand why the station has a ‚Äútoll gate‚Äù bar, but it raises and lowers for extra play. Perhaps it is the opening to the police station's impound lot. I like the surveillance camera detail on the outside of the station.

The police car has room for two of the figures to be seated inside. All of the ‚Äúpolice station‚Äù details--the surveillance camera, the donuts, the uniforms--are printed on the DUPLO blocks. (No annoying stickers for little hands to struggle with!)

The light/sound brick makes this set kind of special. The set includes a toy police car, two police officers, a crook, a big coffee mug, and decorated bricks.

title: Jungle Set Is Delight for Adults, Children Alike
text:
As an adult, I love this LEGO DUPLO TOWN TROPICAL ISLAND 10906 BUILDING SET (73 Pieces) every bit as much as a toddler (age 2+ and up) surely will. The charming DUPLO figures (more doll-like than regular LEGO minifigures) include a caretaker, a traveler, a child, an elephant, a baby elephant, a tiger, a baby tiger, a monkey, and a toucan.

The play scene includes a treehouse with a pulley-operated basket for carrying up supplies, a caretaker's house with a door that opens, a moveable ‚Äúrope‚Äù bridge, and a vine that the monkey can swing on. The set's accessories include a camera, a bunch of bananas, a pineapple, and jungle vegetation.

The figures can be played with separately. All of the figures and accessories can be placed in different locations around the scene. My favorites are the toucan and the pineapple, but all of the figures and accessories are great.

Overall, this particular set is a delight, no matter what your age. Note that the DUPLO sets, which are designed for very young builders with developing motor skills, are NOT compatible with standard LEGO sets. The building blocks in DUPLO sets are much larger than regular LEGO bricks.

The 10906 Tropical Island set is currently unavailable on Amazon, but is still available in the online LEGO Store, as of June 2020.

title: Inexpensive, Colorful Building Set for Preschoolers
text:
This LEGO DUPLO CLASSIC HEART BOX 10909 FIRST BUILDING PLAYSET (for Toddlers; New 2020 (80 Pieces)) is an inexpensive (about $20 retail) set with enough colorful Duplo elements to properly introduce preschoolers (aged 2 years and up) to the wonderful Duplo/LEGO world.

Duplo elements are the big LEGO elements that are designed for preschoolers' hands and motor skills. (Duplo building sets are compatible with other Duplo sets, but are NOT compatible with standard LEGO building sets.)

The Classic Heart Box contains a colorful, fun variety of elements. A few of the blocks have printed details (e.g., googly eyes, a little girl in a car window). Simple instructions are included for building all the models shown on the package: a house, an ice cream bar, a whale, a flower, a helicopter, and a duck. Creative kids will take off from there, and build their own projects.

LEGO-loving parents will want this set for their very young children.

title: Cool Service Station Has Electric Charging Station, Gas Pumps
text:
This LEGO CITY SERVICE STATION 60257 BUILDING SET (New 2020; 354 Pieces) is intended for kids aged 5 years and up, so it's simple to build. Of course, that means there isn't a lot of fine detail in the vehicles and buildings, despite the high piece count. Many of the 354 pieces are small ones, like single round studs for headlights, or a puppy figure, or a hot dog.

Still, this is a rather cool service station, because it includes a charging station for an electric SUV, in addition to gas pumps for a more traditional van. The set includes a mini-convenience store/pay station. The van opens up to show a spacious interior. Both vehicles can accommodate a minifig in the driver's seat. There are 4 minifigs, including a station attendant.

I love all of the City sets, because they illustrate the ordinary jobs, workers, buildings, and vehicles that make up modern cities. The City sets are easy to build, their standard LEGO elements are interchangeable with other LEGO sets (not just the City sets), and they're relatively inexpensive.

title: Orange/White Version of Poe's Orange/Black Fighter From Earlier Set
text:
This LEGO STAR WARS POE DAMERON'S X-WING FIGHTER 75273 BUILDING KIT (New 2020; 761 Pieces) reproduces Poe's fighter from ‚ÄúThe Rise of Skywalker‚Äù. The finished model is the same as Poe's fighter from ‚ÄúThe Force Awakens‚Äù, as reproduced in the earlier, now-retired [[ASIN:B00WHZ6WOO 75102 LEGO set]], except for changes in the color scheme, minifigs, and accessories.

The current kit uses a white and orange scheme; the earlier kit uses a black and orange scheme. I strongly prefer the dramatic black-and-orange model, but I suppose the color schemes are true to the fighters' colors in the actual movies. Both kits include a Poe Dameron minifig. The current kit adds a minifig for Janna and one for a Knight of Ren. The current kit has an R2D2 droid; the earlier kit has a BB8 droid.

The fighter is fairly easy and fast to build. It's a bit boring, because the four wings have many parts, but are quite similar in construction. The model shoots studs from alongside the cockpit, and bolts from beneath the wings. (This model strikes me as being more dangerous to the eyes than most of the bolt-shooting models, because the position of the launchers makes it hard to load the bolts without looking straight at the business end of the bolts. Kids should maybe wear goggles when playing with this model.)

When the model is properly constructed, the wings fold flat for non-combat flight, ground maintenance, and storage; and open into their combat X-configuration when you shift a lever from the rear to the front of the fuselage. (The lever locks into place--if yours doesn't, just check the triple-armed connectors between the wings. One of my connectors was dislodged from a rod during the build, so that the lever didn't lock. Once the connector was reaffixed, the build became rock-solid.) The landing gear folds up flat for flight.

If you download the LEGO BUILDING INSTRUCTIONS app or the LEGO LIFE app, you can scan the Maze code on the cover of the instructions booklet and easily download the building instructions for this kit to a mobile device. (The apps are available for iOS or Android, at the App Store or Google Play, respectively.) The downloaded instructions are the same as the printed ones--there are no 360-degree views available, as with some of the newest LEGO sets.

A reason to download the apps, is that they will keep a record of the sets you own. If you ever need to know whether you purchased a particular set, or if you mislay the instructions and need them again for a rebuild, you will be able to retrieve that information easily.

title: Much More Interesting Than ‚ÄúClassic‚Äù Alphabet Blocks
text:
This LEGO DUPLO MY FIRST ALPHABET TRUCK ((10915) New 2020, 36 Pieces) is aimed at very young builders, aged 18 months and up. The DUPLO elements (NOT compatible with the elements in standard LEGO sets) are very large, designed for toddlers who are still developing their fine motor skills.

The DUPLO truck holds 26 alphabet blocks--each block is printed with a single letter on one side. This gives you and your child a complete set of alphabet blocks for teaching/learning ABCs.

The blocks are so much more interesting than a ‚Äúclassic‚Äù set of alphabet blocks! They can be stacked like regular blocks, and also loaded on and off the two truck trailers.

The set includes three doll-like play figures: a girl, a boy, and a teddy bear. The set also includes a flat sheet with the alphabet blocks printed full-size, in A-Z order, for learning the order of the letters.

Twenty-six of the thirty-six pieces are used for the alphabet blocks. (There isn't much assembly required in this set.) I wish that this delightful, versatile set had been available when I was learning my own ABCs!

title: ‚ÄúTroll World Tour‚Äù Movie Scene Is Fun to Assemble
text:
Critics may have panned the ‚ÄúTrolls World Tour‚Äù movie, but this LEGO TROLLS WORLD TOUR POPPY'S HOT AIR BALLOON ADVENTURE BUILDING KIT ((41252) New 2020, 250 Pieces) is still fun to assemble and play with. The easy-to-build set is aimed at builders aged 6 and older.

Assembling the rods for the balloon cables is good pre-training for the challenging, adult-level Technic kits (which often incorporate the same rods and connecting elements). The graphics on the balloon are printed, but there are a few stickers that need to be applied to small elements.

The building kit has three troll minifigs that can ride in the balloon. Some of the assembled pieces have flipping movements for added play potential. There are a lot of small pieces, which add to the building time. However, there isn't a whole lot of detail in the set.

title: Another Fine Addition to City-Themed LEGO
text:
This LEGO CITY RACE BOAT TRANSPORTER BUILDING SET ((60254) New 2020, 238 Pieces) is fairly easy to build--the difficulty is what I'd call ‚Äúnormal‚Äù for a City-themed set. City sets are among my favorites, because they include fire trucks, police stations, buses, trains, beachgoer minifigs, space stations, and all the rest of the things that a bustling city (or the airspace above it) needs. This particular set is aimed at ages 5 and up.

The set contains all the pieces required to build three separate items: a semi-trailer truck (for towing the race boat), a trailer for hauling the race boat, and a race boat. (You can use the truck's trailer hitch to tow other things that you build, of course.)

The ‚ÄúXtreme‚Äù graphics are NOT printed on the pieces, but are applied with stickers. (I hate stickers, too.) Applying stickers is made easier if you first stick a corner to something long and thin (e.g., a spudger or a plastic knife) so that you can better control the placement on the element. A good thing about LEGO stickers is that they can be removed and replaced (like Post-Its) if you get them misaligned.

The LEGO elements are compatible with other City sets and with all regular LEGO sets (but not with DUPLO sets, which have extra-large pieces for very young builders). The Race Boat Transporter set is another fine addition to the extensive collection of City sets.

title: Toy Off Road Vehicle Is Incredibly Easy, Fun to Drive
text:
This LEGO TECHNIC 4x4 XTREME OFF ROADER BUILDING KIT ((42099) 958 Pieces) produces a toy that is incredibly easy and fun to drive. The off road vehicle is controlled entirely by an app (the LEGO Control+ app), which is available for free from either Google Play or the App Store. It's probably easiest to install the app on your iOS or Android phone, so that you have an easy-to-hold device that feels like a game controller.

The LEGO Control+ app has two control modes: one-touch and multi-function. One-touch shows you the vehicle, and you control the direction (forward, reverse, turning) by moving a finger on the touchscreen.
